comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for locating this site Retired at last.  It certainly could be Winnington-Ingram as he held the title during the time period. What's throwing me off is his uniform, as I can't find an image of him in anything other than the long frock coat illustrated in the cartoon.  Let's keep investigating.

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: @ Ryan (LOC P&P) And anything relevant on this site www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/person.php?LinkID=mp048... isn't available on line. I wonder if they could help you, museum to museum.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: NPG is a great resource, retired at last, thank you. Plenty of images to verify his identity. We'll add some of the information to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: His cap badge is the (British) Army Chaplain's Corps
